timeline.bodyText: could you clarify why was the call to resolveEntityClassNames removed?
timeline.author: dmitry-s
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -245,8 +245,7 @@ private List executeReadSql(Pageable pageable, Sort sort, QueryTagValue queryTag
 
 		queryTagValue.sql = SpannerStatementQueryExecutor
 				.applySortingPagingQueryOptions(this.entityType, spannerQueryOptions,
-						resolveEntityClassNames(queryTagValue.sql),

replies.bodyText: the executeReadSql method is invoked only from the executeRawResult where resolveEntityClassNames  already invoked in the line 222
replies.author: s13o

replies.bodyText: we should better invoke it once in the constructor of QueryTagValue and mark the field 'sql' as final
replies.author: s13o

replies.bodyText:
Ok so executeReadSql is only called from executeRawResult, and resolveEntityClassNames is done there.
I think the best way to fix that would be to call resolveEntityClassNames in the constructor, this way the sql field will always have resolved class names and there will be no need for any individual method to do that.
replies.author: dmitry-s

replies.bodyText:
Basically It is already like this, but without changing the constructor's signature.
I've just removed a double invocation because I believe this method is costly
replies.author: s13o

replies.bodyText: Well, what if I'll add one more commit? Will it become added to the PR automatically or I should cancel the PR and create a new one?
replies.author: s13o

replies.bodyText: it will be added to the PR
replies.author: dmitry-s

timeline.bodyText: if you will check the invocation stack you will find that the method 'resolveEntityClassNames' has been already applied to queryTagValue.sql
timeline.author: s13o
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -245,8 +245,7 @@ private List executeReadSql(Pageable pageable, Sort sort, QueryTagValue queryTag
 
 		queryTagValue.sql = SpannerStatementQueryExecutor
 				.applySortingPagingQueryOptions(this.entityType, spannerQueryOptions,
-						resolveEntityClassNames(queryTagValue.sql),

timeline.bodyText: I knew that, but you requested to modify the constructor :)
timeline.author: s13o
